OpenLab Identity

The OpenLab is a resource for open art and design practices at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago. It was founded by artist and coder Christopher Baker. For design direction, Christopher pointed me to the symbol of a heart, and to a YouTube video of American writer Clay Shirky, who argues that open source philosophy is fueled by the ideas we pursue for "love, internet-style".

I designed a simple, friendly website that was built in collaboration with Andrew Kaye, Brannon Dorsey and Christopher Baker.

This is an article introducing the OpenLab to the SAIC community. It was published in the February issue of Fnewsmagazine. For the illustration, I asked each Fnews staff member to contribute the drawing of a heart.
